intro: Sceletium albanense, commonly known as the Albanian kanna, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Albania. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing features such as reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Sceletium albanense is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to harsh climates.
